texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["If you're 60 or over and live in a London borough, you can get free travel on our transport services with an Oyster photocard."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"image","link":{"image":{}},"image":{"url":"https://tfl.gov.uk/cdn/static/cms/images/60-london-oyster-photocard.png","alt":"60 plus london oyster photocard"},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Benefits"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Free travel on bus, Tube, tram, DLR, London Overground, TfL Rail (excluding between West Drayton and Reading) and most National Rail services in London","Discounted fares on the \u003ca href=\"/modes/emirates-air-line/index\"\u003eEmirates Air Line\u003c/a\u003e ","Discounted fares on \u003ca href=\"/modes/river/index\"\u003eRiver Services\u003c/a\u003e "]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Travel on National Rail"}
You can travel free on most National Rail services from 09:30 on weekdays and anytime on weekends and public holidays.
You can travel free on these National Rail services, at any time:

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"60+ London free travel on National Rail map","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/60-plus-london-free-travel-national-rail-map.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 31KB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}

{"template":"table","titles":["Service","Between"],"rows":[[],["Chiltern Railway","Amersham and Marylebone"],["Chiltern Railway","West Ruislip and South Ruislip"],["Great Northern","Finsbury Park and King's Cross and Moorgate"],["Thameslink","West Hampstead Thameslink, Elephant \u0026 Castle and London Bridge"],["London Northwestern Railway","Harrow \u0026 Wealdstone and Euston"],["Greater Anglia","Stratford and Liverpool Street"],["c2c","Upminster and Fenchurch Street"]]}
These routes are free if you travel from 09:00 or 09:30 on weekdays, weekends and public holidays:

{"template":"table","titles":["Service","Between","Travel from"],"rows":[[],["Southern","Clapham Junction and Harrow \u0026 Wealdstone","09:00"],["Southern","New Cross Gate and West Croydon/Crystal Palace","09:30"],["Southern","Peckham Rye and Queens Road","09:30"],["Southeastern","Denmark Hill and Peckham Rye","09:30"]]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Who is it for?"}
If you're 60 or over and live in a London borough , you can get a 60+ London Oyster photocard until you're eligible for a Freedom Pass .
You can't get a 60+ London Oyster photocard if you already have a Veterans Oyster photocard .
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"How to apply"}
You apply online for a 60+ London Oyster photocard from two weeks before your 60th birthday.
You need to provide:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Active email address","Details from your machine-readable passport or UK driving licence (full or provisional)","A scanned colour image of your machine readable passport. This must be in .png or .jpg format and be less than 6MB. The image must show your photo, personal details and passport number","Digital photo of you which must be a .jpg, .bmp or .gif file and be less than 6MB","Debit or credit card registered at your address to confirm you live in a \u003ca href=\"https://directory.londoncouncils.gov.uk/\"\u003eLondon borough\u003c/a\u003e and to pay an administration fee of £20"]}
If you don't have these, you can still apply online but may be asked to:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Print a verification letter and take it to a \u003ca href=\"https://www.postoffice.co.uk/branchfinder1\"\u003ePost Office\u003c/a\u003e in London with proof of your age and address","Pay an administration fee of £20 at a Post Office"]}
Proof of age can be one of the following:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Passport","An ID card from a European Economic Area country","Medical Card","Birth certificate","Driving licence","Biometric Residency Permit"]}
Proof of address can be one of the following:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Residential utility bill (from last three months)","Bank, building society or credit statement (from last three months)","Department for Work and Pensions letter (from last three months)","HM Revenue and Customs letter (from last three months)","Occupational pension letter (from last three months)","Council Tax bill","Television licence","Driving licence","Council or Housing Association rent book or statement"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Need help applying?"}
If you need help applying, call us on 0343 222 1234 ( call charges may apply ) with:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Your date of birth","Your address","Details from your machine-readable passport or UK driving licence (full or provisional)","Debit or credit card registered at your address to confirm you live in London and to pay an administration fee of £20"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Check your application status"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["When you apply for your 60+ London Oyster photocard, we'll set up a photocard web account for you. You can check your application status when you \u003ca href=\"https://photocard.tfl.gov.uk/tfl/showLogon.do\"\u003esign in to your photocard web account\u003c/a\u003e ","Text your application reference number to \u003ca href=\"tel:07624 809 330\"\u003e07624 809 330\u003c/a\u003e . You'll receive a response from our SMS service (standard network charges apply)"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"How to use"}
Once you get your 60+ London Oyster photocard, you can use it straight away.
Make sure you touch in at the start of your journey and touch out at the end on yellow card readers. You only need to touch in on buses and trams.
Use your photocard web account to manage your card or report a lost card.
You can't add credit to your 60+ London Oyster photocard to pay as you go .
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Yearly address check and fee"}
You need to provide proof of your London borough address and pay £10 (non-refundable) for each year you have your photocard.
We'll let you know when to do this. Use your photocard web account to keep your contact details up to date.
If you don't provide proof, your photocard will be stopped.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Expiry"}
When your 60+ London Oyster photocard expires you may be eligible for a Freedom Pass .
If you agreed to share your data with London Councils when you applied for your 60+ London Oyster photocard, they'll send you a letter to confirm your name and address.
Once they've received confirmation and you meet the criteria for a Freedom Pass, London Councils will send you a Freedom Pass. You don't need to apply or provide a new photo.
